description: Authoritative clinical materials for RAG-based depression diagnosis system
purpose: Provide evidence-based diagnostic criteria, clinical guidelines, and assessment tools for depression diagnosis

documents.title: Diagnostic and Statistical Manual of Mental Disorders (5th ed., text rev.)
documents.author: American Psychiatric Association
documents.citation: American Psychiatric Association. (2022). Diagnostic and statistical manual of mental disorders (5th ed., text rev.). https://doi.org/10.1176/appi.books.9780890425787
documents.notes: Primary diagnostic criteria source. Gold standard for US clinical practice.

documents.title: ICD-11 Clinical Descriptions and Diagnostic Requirements for Mental, Behavioural and Neurodevelopmental Disorders
documents.author: World Health Organization
documents.citation: World Health Organization. (2024). ICD-11 for mortality and morbidity statistics: Clinical descriptions and diagnostic requirements for ICD-11 mental, behavioural and neurodevelopmental disorders. https://icd.who.int/browse11/l-m/en#/http://id.who.int/icd/entity/334423054
documents.notes: International diagnostic standard. Complements DSM-5-TR with global perspective.

documents.title: Practice Guideline for the Treatment of Patients With Major Depressive Disorder (3rd ed.)
documents.author: American Psychiatric Association
documents.citation: American Psychiatric Association. (2010). Practice guideline for the treatment of patients with major depressive disorder (3rd ed.). https://psychiatryonline.org/pb/assets/raw/sitewide/practice_guidelines/guidelines/mdd.pdf
documents.notes: Clinical reasoning and treatment approach for MDD. Shows application of diagnostic criteria.

documents.title: Practice Guideline for the Treatment of Patients With Bipolar Disorder (2nd ed.)
documents.author: American Psychiatric Association
documents.citation: American Psychiatric Association. (2010). Practice guideline for the treatment of patients with bipolar disorder (2nd ed.). https://psychiatryonline.org/pb/assets/raw/sitewide/practice_guidelines/guidelines/bipolar.pdf
documents.notes: Essential for differential diagnosis between unipolar and bipolar depression. Critical for accurate diagnosis.

documents.title: Clinical Practice Guideline for the Treatment of Depression Across Three Age Cohorts
documents.author: American Psychological Association
documents.citation: American Psychological Association. (2019). Clinical practice guideline for the treatment of depression across three age cohorts. https://www.apa.org/depression-guideline
documents.notes: Provides developmental context and assessment considerations across lifespan. Psychological perspective complements psychiatric guidelines.

documents.title: Structured Clinical Interview for DSM-5 Disorders: SCID-5-CV Clinician Version
documents.author: First, M. B., Williams, J. B. W., Karg, R. S., & Spitzer, R. L.
documents.citation: First, M. B., Williams, J. B. W., Karg, R. S., & Spitzer, R. L. (2016). Structured clinical interview for DSM-5 disorders: SCID-5-CV clinician version. American Psychiatric Association Publishing.
documents.notes: Operationalizes DSM-5 criteria into systematic assessment. Shows how to translate patient language into diagnostic criteria.

documents.title: Depressive Disorder (Depression) - WHO Fact Sheet
documents.author: World Health Organization
documents.citation: World Health Organization. (2025, November 7). Depressive disorder (depression). https://www.who.int/news-room/fact-sheets/detail/depression
documents.notes: Patient-facing language and accessible descriptions. Complements technical diagnostic criteria.

usage_notes.retrieval_priority: Prefer DSM-5-TR and ICD-11 for diagnostic criteria. Use clinical guidelines for differential diagnosis and clinical reasoning. Use SCID-5 for assessment operationalization.
usage_notes.citation_preference: Always cite DSM-5-TR or ICD-11 when stating diagnostic criteria. Reference guidelines for clinical approach.
usage_notes.version_control: DSM-5-TR (2022) and ICD-11 (2024) are most current. APA guidelines from 2010 should be used for clinical reasoning but cross-referenced with current diagnostic criteria.
